title: Ambulance waits: 'Can you please tell them to hurry up or I shall be dead'
description: As the health safety watchdog warns on ambulance delays, the BBC investigates the case of 94-year-old Ken Shadbolt.

title: Wheels and wheelchairs team up for high speed fun
description: Roller skating isn’t necessarily an activity a lot of wheelchair users might expect to take part in, but Wheels and Wheelchairs is helping to change that.

title: Hot spell: What can we expect in the next few days
description: The European heatwave is bringing hot weather to parts of the UK. Helen Willetts explains how high the temperatures might get and how long it could last.

title: Ukraine war: Thousands of civilians trapped in Severodonetsk
description: Food and water are running out for the women and children still there, a UN official tells the BBC.

title: Round-up: City under siege and how Russia sanctions struggle
description: We hear about life in Severodonetsk - and look at whether Russia's economy will survive Western sanctions.

title: Ella Toone: Manchester United forward dishes the dirt on England team-mates
description: England forward Ella Toone dishes the dirt on her team-mates before the women's Euros this summer.

title: Supreme Court: Rifts divide abortion views in Mississippi
description: All eyes are on Mississippi as the US awaits a Supreme Court decision involving its last abortion clinic.

title: In the room where Ukraine orders arms from the West
description: From an attic room in Germany, the West coordinates the supply of arms to Ukraine - but is it enough?

title: Hot weather: How to sleep in the heat
description: A simple guide on how to get a good night's sleep in the heat.

title: Passengers told not to travel by train during rail strikes
description: Only a fifth of train services are due to run during next week's strike action.

title: Rwanda: We're committed to asylum plan, says Priti Patel
description: Home Secretary Priti Patel says the government will not be deterred from doing the "right thing".

title: Microsoft retires Internet Explorer after 27 years
description: Internet Explorer, once the most popular web browser, will no longer be accessible for most users.

title: Heatwaves: All you need to know
description: Matt Taylor explains exactly what defines a heatwave in the UK.

title: Petrol prices hit new highs every day for a month
description: The RAC calls for more government action to ease inflation and pressure on motorists.

title: UK heatwave: How does sunscreen work?
description: Do you know your UVA from your UVB?

title: Hong Kong: New school books claim territory was not a British colony
description: The books assert China's claims of unbroken sovereignty over the territory despite the UK's long rule.

title: Heineken says Father's Day beer contest is a scam
description: A message circulating on WhatsApp offering the chance to win beer is a phishing scam, Heineken says.

title: Ugo Monye: Former England wing says rugby union must tackle 'drinking culture'
description: Ugo Monye says rugby union must tackle its "heavy drinking" and "laddish" culture to become fully inclusive.

title: NHS racism making doctors 'anxious and depressed'
description: The doctors' union warns institutional racism harms medics' mental health and therefore patient care.

title: James Patterson: US author sorry for saying white writers face racism
description: The best-selling US author apologises for saying older white writers face a form of racism.

title: Gareth Southgate: After a 'Damaging & humiliating' defeat, can England boss be a winner?
description: After England's humiliating loss to Hungary, BBC Sport's Phil McNulty analyses what it means for Gareth Southgate's future.

title: EU takes new legal action against UK over post-Brexit deal changes
description: Brussels says altering the Northern Ireland Protocol breaks international law, but the UK disputes this.

title: Oxford Street: Counterfeit chocolate 'worth £100,000' seized
description: The counterfeit Wonka Bars were being sold at US-themed candy shops on the famous shopping street.

title: Ukrainian widow: My baby and I were kidnapped
description: Viktoria and her surviving child have been waiting for nearly 50 days to get a UK visa.

title: Millions to get first cost-of-living payment from 14 July
description: More than eight million UK homes will get the first of two cost-of-living payments totalling £650.

title: Northern Ireland Protocol: Is Truss right about public opinion?
description: Is there a majority in favour of changes to Northern Ireland's Brexit deal?

title: Joe Root: England batsman returns to top of Test rankings
description: England's Joe Root returns to the top of the men's batting Test rankings after his fourth century of 2022.

title: Valtteri Bottas: Alfa Romeo driver says 'porpoising' is 'getting quite serious'
description: Alfa Romeo's Valtteri Bottas says 'porpoising' in F1 is "getting quite serious" and believes it could cause injuries to drivers.

title: Nupur Sharma controversy: Prayagraj demolition breaks a family's dream
description: The demolition of Muslim activist Afreen Fatima's house in India has left her family and neighbours in fear.

title: Lady Evelyn Cobbold - why are Muslim pilgrims visiting her Scottish grave?
description: Converts to the religion gathered to pay their respects at a remote burial site in Wester Ross.

title: Historic English pubs recognised for their interiors
description: Historic England says the interiors help "tell the fascinating story of pubs over the centuries".

title: Rebel Wilson outing sparks Australia media reckoning
description: A newspaper's defence to outing the actor has thrown up questions around ethical journalism.

title: Voters oust Republican who backed impeaching Trump
description: Tom Rice had acknowledged he could be politically doomed, but said he was following his conscience.

title: Netflix plans real-life Squid Game reality TV show with $4.56m prize
description: It will see 456 contestants compete in a series of challenges inspired by the dystopian drama.

title: Babushka Z: The woman who became a Russian propaganda icon
description: A video of an elderly woman brandishing a Soviet flag went viral, but what really happened?
